About Me

An analytical Full Stack Software Engineer and Web Developer, who is also an Austin Native with an interest in both front end and back end programming.

Bio



Born and raised in Austin TX, Cooper Pearson is an avid percussionist and graduate of Lake Travis High School. After graduating, he attended the University of Texas. Cooper achieved his Pharmacy Tech license in 2007 and became lead technician at Medical Park Tower Pharmacy. After Medical Park Tower closed its doors in 2016, Cooper decided to become a Full Stack Software Engineer, and finish his Bachelors at the University of Texas at Austin.



Skills include: HTML5, Javascript, JQuery, CSS3, SQL, MongoDB, Mongo, Handlebars, SASS, SCSS, Bootstrap, Node.js, MySQL, Express.js, Cheerio, Sequelize, Mapbox, Materialize, Next.js, React.js, WordPress, Ajax

Testimonials

My Colleagues and Co-Workers

Cooper Pearson was a student of mine at the Full Stack Flex Coding Bootcamp at the University of Texas at Austin. Cooper was one of the most capable students in his cohort, and more importantly, he displayed a strong work ethic. Cooper is not afraid of failure, or hard work, and will put in the hours necessary to be successful. Cooper also collaborates well with others, and proved to be a valuable teammate in all of his group projects. I have no reservations at all in recommending Cooper Pearson to any organization that he seeks to join.

  • Sean Fleming, Student Manager, Coding & Data Analytics & UX/UI & Cybersecurity Boot Camps at UT Austin

I worked closely with Cooper several projects and I was struck by his ability to keep our team focused an on target. He was always a pleasure to work with and I look forward to working with him on future projects.

  • Daniel Hawn, Full Stack Software Engineer
